sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The boke of knowledge whether a sycke person beynge in perylle, shall lyue, or dye. &c. Hippocrates, attributed name.
[12] p.
Imprynted by me Robert Wyer: dwellynge at the sygne of saynte John̄ Euangelyste in saynt Martyns parysshe, in the Duke of Suffolkes rentes besyde Charynge Crosse, [London : [1556?]]
Sometimes attributed to Hippocrates. Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: A⁴ B² . Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Sometimes attributed to Hippocrates. Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: A⁴ B² . Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
me Robert Wyer:
the sygne of saynte John̄ Euangelyste in saynt Martyns parysshe, in the Duke of Suffolkes rentes besyde Charynge Crosse
